properties.Name: TermInsurancePolicy
properties.Description:
Term life insurance provides protection for a specified period of time only - for example, one year, five years or until the insured reaches a specific age.    

Term life insurance does not accumulate nonforfeiture values such as those associated with Whole Life insurance policies.

Term life insurance provides life insurance protection for a specified period (or term) and pays a benefit only if the insured dies during that period.

Most term insurance policies are convertible into permanent insurance.

Columns.Name: InsurancePolicyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Insurance Policy.

Columns.Name: AutomaticRenewableTermIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the Term Insurance Policy is automatically renewable.

Columns.Name: ConvertibleToWholeLifeInsuranceIndicator
Columns.Description:
Indicates that the term insurance policy may be converted to a whole life insurance policy.

The conversion of an Insurance Policy from one form to another by contractual provision and without evidence of insurability.

Most term insurance policies are convertible into permanent insurance.

Columns.Name: IssuedForNumberYears
Columns.Description:
The number of years for which the Term Insurance policy is issued.

Term life insurance provides protection for a specified period of time only - for example, one year, five years or until the insured reaches a specific age.    

Term life insurance provides life insurance protection for a specified period (or term) and pays a benefit only if the insured dies during that period.

Columns.Name: IssuedUntilAge
Columns.Description:
The age at which the insurance will no longer be issued.

Term life insurance provides protection for a specified period of time only - for example, one year, five years or until the insured reaches a specific age.    

Term life insurance provides life insurance protection for a specified period (or term) and pays a benefit only if the insured dies during that period.

Properties.Description:
Term life insurance provides protection for a specified period of time only - for example, one year, five years or until the insured reaches a specific age.    

Term life insurance does not accumulate nonforfeiture values such as those associated with Whole Life insurance policies.

Term life insurance provides life insurance protection for a specified period (or term) and pays a benefit only if the insured dies during that period.

Most term insurance policies are convertible into permanent insurance.
